Reviews.Title: “Out of centre”
Reviews.Author: Jennyfartpants
Reviews.Content: Nice clean hotel albeit without much personality. Good continental breakfast with decent coffee. Right on tube line of u2 which stops direct at many tourist spots. Unfortunately while we stayed there was a flood on the tube line with replacement buses which made the journey to alexanderplatz take one hour. Which was a treck when going into town n back twice a day. Next time I will get somewhere closer into town, however for the price I can't complain. Went on fat tire bike tour which was a great fun way to see the city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: Noceto
Reviews.Content: VERY pleasantly surprised as this was part of a cheap mini-break with Easyjet. We were impressed for the same reasons as other reviewers and endorse their comments re. location, spacious rooms, comfort, breakfast and cleanliness. The place was absolutely SPOTLESS. Most guests seemed to be business people and the hotel doesn't aspire to offer anything other than a comfortable, clean place to sleep and a decent breakfast. This it does very well and we'd certainly stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Lovely break in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Sam45
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 night break in Berlin - first time. Underground very near to the Hotel which was great value for money - clean, comfortable beds, fantastic breakfast and surrounded by great value restaurants - recommend Adilinos Italian just round the corner on the main street nearby the underground. Has a cocktail menu and the best menu with fresh pasta dishes. Run by friendly staff and two twin brothers.

Reviews.Title: “Just the job”
Reviews.Author: osinac
Reviews.Content: We had no choice, as we booked a low cost three night package. However, the hotel was excellent. The room was big enough with the toilet and shower/sink separated. Everything worked and the beds were very comfy. The room was very clean. Breakfast more than adequate. Very near Theodor Heuss U bahn (U2). Recommend Lindenwirten Restaurant on Linden Strasse, easy walk from Hotel. Also go to Ka de We food hall (level 6), we've never seen anything as good. Go hungry. (Easy to get to, go to Wittenburg Platz on U2). We also enjoyed the insider tour Berlin walk.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: agataa
Reviews.Content: stayed in this hotel for 3 nights. room was good size with seperate toilet. clean, comfortable beds. heating worked really well. had to switch it off over night as it was very hot. very small tv in the room with only 2 english chanels. didn't have breakfast as 9e pp was a bit too much. lots of food options near by. took us about 1h to get to the hotel from the airport. metro station 3 min walk. overall really good stay. recommended.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Major_Bene
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel located nearby a train station. There are a lot of food places nearby and supermarket. All the staff are very nice and helpful. The breakfast is pretty decent with a selection of cold cuts and bread. The room is clean with separate toilet and shower. If you are planning to go with a friend and you are not comfortable being watched while taking a bath, don't get this. The tiny shower area only has a see-through glass door (I am not sure though if all rooms are the same). One thing though, they should improve on their wifi service. The staff told me that their only router is located at the ground floor. I stayed at the very last room on the 5th floor and I had to stay at corridor to get one bar of wifi connection because it doesn't go into the room. Also, the hallway on the 5th floor (i am not sure with the other floors) is very dark. It uses a sensor to turn on the lights - one yellow light at the end of the hallway, and going to the fire exit. It can be quite freaky at night because it is too dark. You can't even see where the lift is.

Reviews.Title: “VALUE FOR MONEY? NO, MUCH LESS.”
Reviews.Author: MariaPopellow
Reviews.Content: I am very disappointed that I did not read the reviews on tripadvisor before booking. Do not book unless you like throwing away your cash- which we had unintentionally :( A few dot points for easy reading: WIFI --> a) Does not work at all, as mentioned by a few reviewers already (should have read this before booking). Ivberg staff gave a few excuses: "Berlin is busy this time of year. The internet must be busy." "I called the technician. He fixed it and when you came down to use it - it didn't work again." "I'm sorry it is not my fault. You'll just have to do without." "When things are free - people tend to expect it." SERVICE --> a) Do not expect to be serviced beyond your payment. Ivbergs will expect upfront payment before you step into your room and will not help you beyond this point. ROOM --> a) Odour emitting from carpet b) No shower door so do not expect any privacy. c) Lamp on bedside did not function. d) Coat hanger falls off upon use. e) Cheap cardboard-like walls- expect your conversations to be heard in the next room. f) Moss on balcony BREAKFAST --> a) Would recommend walking 2mins to the nearest cafe. Beautiful breakfasts at 1/4 of the price. If you opt for the hotel breakfast - you will be staring at the receptionist's desk and emergency exit instead of a beautiful view of Berlin. Best look elsewhere - do not get desperate as you can find better hotels at a similar location.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: macala
Reviews.Content: Just back from 4 days in Berlin. Opted for this hotel over others because of the good reviews on Trip Advisor. Although a little way out of the city centre, it is close to the U-Bahn station, and the Berlin underground is uncrowded (compared to other cities) punctual, regular, safe and easy to use. The Hotel is clean, with a good choice of options at breakfast. The receptionists were very friendly and helpful, and arranged a taxi back to the airport as our flight was early in the morning. We had got the train and underground from the airport (Scholenfeld)when we arrived. There are some nice restaurants close to the hotel. Would stay again if visiting Berlin. If you are okay about staying away from the city centre, though closer to Charlotenberg Palace, the Olympic Stadium and Spandau, and about half way to the zoo, then this is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location”
Reviews.Author: auntyjFareham
Reviews.Content: Booked through Octopus and got an amazing price - only £140 for 4 nights. We travelled by Eurolines coach and the hotel is a short walk from ZOB (Central bus station) where the coach drops off. Both U-bahn and bus services are close to the hotel. Usual buffet breakfast - I only missed a prepared fruit salad. Otherwise good selection of both cold and hot items. Free internet available. Clean and comfortable room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: kara_louise_hudson
Reviews.Content: Great hotel we got in an easyjet package!!! great value lovely breakfast every morning and very helpful receptionists.... would definately recommend it... great location minutes to the nearest tram....

Reviews.Title: “Very good value”
Reviews.Author: Glen H
Reviews.Content: Very good value hotel, we got as part of a package with Easyjet, whilst it is a distance out of the centre away from the main sights it has excellent transport liinks, Theodor-Heuss-Platz U Bahn is literally 2 mins walk, and M49/X34 buses stop in TH Platz and get you to Zoo Bahnof within 15 mins. I was aware of this when I booked as I lived in Berlin for 2 years and to me was not an issue as i know that Berlin public transport is efficient. There are a selection of Restaurants /shops in the locality. Whilst there is a major road outside (Heer Strasse) we didnt really get any road noise and we were at the front The room was clean and functional, bathroom and toilet being separate. The shower area was potentially dangerous in that it could get slippy, but that is about the only criticism. Breakfast (included in our package) was good having a selection of cold meats, bread, cereals as well as hot dishes e.g Scrambled eggs, bacon. Good selection of teas,juice and coffee. The Ivbergs is a basic no frills hotel that does exactly what is expected of it, its is well located, clean and to me is an ideal choice. Excellent value

Reviews.Title: “Berlin trip between 19 and 23 September 2011”
Reviews.Author: Christopher B
Reviews.Content: My wife and myself flew from Liverpool to Berlin with Easy jet which for the short flight was good. Upon arrival at Belin got on the Airport express service on platform 4 which took us to the Zooilogical gardens where we got the U-Bahn to Theodor Huess Platz. Less than 200 meters was the hotel. The hotel is a clean and tidy hotel with friendly staff who speak a good level of english. The room had very comfortable beds, a great shower with seperate toilet which is good when getting ready to go out. Only two english news channels on tv but for the time you are in the room is ok. The staff are really helpfull and you can purchase welcome cards at the reception which give you discounts around Berlin and can include entrance to the Museium Island and about 8 Museiums. We went to one which was enough for us. The breakfast was excellent with a varity of breads, scrambled eggs, bacon or sausage, a selection of cold meats, toast, cerials and tea and coffee. Near the hotel is a number of supermarkets for cheap wine and imbiss stands which serve great food. The wife loved the cakes which were out of this world. Adilinos italian restuarant is great aswell. The location of the hotel enables you to eat alot cheaper than in the city centre where a beer was on average 3.50 euros for a small beer. I recommend the imbiss stands for cheap food and a nice berliner beer. I have nothing but praise for the hotel, location, people and the city it self. I am already looking for my next holiday in berlin.

Reviews.Title: “That was much more than we'd expected!!!”
Reviews.Author: Anna V
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this hotel 2 weeks ago. we'd chosen it at random with only one thing on our minds - didn't want to spend much on accommodation. but it was so much better than we'd expected!!! First of all - breakfasts!!! the food was so great i ate 3 times more than I usually do. My husband had dinners as well, but I only waited for mornings))) Second - the staff was really helpful! answered all our questions and helped in all ways possible! Third - very clean nice rooms. nothing outstanding, but we felt at home. which is very important after 10-hour long walks! Fourth - beds in the room were sooooo comfortable! i only could get up when i thought of the coming breakfast)))) I recommend everybody to stay there! yes, it's far from the city center, but we liked our neighborhood even more. SERIOUSLY

Reviews.Title: “very convenient hotel”
Reviews.Author: VishalShivani
Reviews.Content: we have been staying at this hotel every march during ITB , it is very convenient to stay at this hotel during fairs, Just 04 min walking distance from the hotel. breakfast is good. rooms are a bit small but cant complaint at the price .

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NewEnglandtravel80
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as part of a package and didn't know what to expect but I was pleasantly surprised. The Hotel is clean and quiet and the room is well appointed. The buffet breakfast was very good and generous. We travelled from Schoenefeld Airport on the train and underground in just over an hour. The same underground station is a two minute walk away and will take you into the centre in fifteen to twenty minutes. The only niggle I have is that the girl on reception one night took the huff when we asked for extra blankets. I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I would go back anytime”
Reviews.Author: Bobbysher
Reviews.Content: I got there on Wed 27th October,, The staff are very helpfull, and Courteous, , The room Clean and Comfortable, Internet via wired in rooms is fast, went for breakfast at 9,30am first morning, bacon was cold but nice on the sesame seed rolls, nice pot of earls grey tea , second morning, was down for breaky at 6, bacon was piping hot breakfast is nice I ate out accross the road at San Marco as I like Italian food, thats a gem of a place and good price , Overall, I was happy with Ivbergs , its very central, for Brandenberg gate etc, , underground ticket 6 euro for 3 zones can be used on bus to, great value

Reviews.Title: “Stay at the Cholottenberg branch if possible.”
Reviews.Author: tumbuna
Reviews.Content: This hotel demanded payment up front on a flexible booking. The WiFi did not work on the 4th floor and only intermittently on the 3rd. The staff were not helpful at all about the WiFi problem and huffed when asked to change rooms as I needed to use the WiFi. Breakfast is good value and the rooms are quite new and clean. Situated 2-3 minutes walk from station with restaurants and supermarkets nearby. Walls of rooms so thin can hear even the slightest sniffle from neighbours. Air-conditioning did not work.

Reviews.Title: “Very conveneint if you are visiting Messe Berlin”
Reviews.Author: shrimind
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel after reading a review on tripadvisor.com. The location of the hotel is the best when you have work at Messe Berlin / ICC. The hotel is around 5 minutes walking distance from the fair ground and the ICC. The rooms are small but comfortable. The breakfast was a complete let-down because not many options were offered for the price that was charged. This hotel is recommended for sure if you have work at Messe berlin or the ICC. The best part was free internet.

Reviews.Title: “NO Air conditioning”
Reviews.Author: schl450
Reviews.Content: We stay for 4 nights, The Air conditioning did not work at our room and at rooms of other guests. Berlin is a hot city in jun & july and with no Air conditioning in the room you can not breathe.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bielik
Reviews.Content: Hotel is contemporary, spanking clean and quiet, with very friendly and helpful staff. It is not in the center, but is well situated for public transport. The breakfast looked very good, but we preferred to eat in one of a few cafeterias near-by. Lots of shopping nearby. We had a very good experience staying here and we will return.

Reviews.Title: “lovely place, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: emmajade7
Reviews.Content: great place. lovely room, so quiet. Reception so helpful..thankyou Jenny. So quiet,so clean really happy with everything

Reviews.Title: “Great location for trade fairs, a business hotel with one ironing board !”
Reviews.Author: JohnLLondon
Reviews.Content: If you are going to a trade show at Messe Berlin then the location is unsurpassed as it is 10 minutes walk away. It is good value. Size wise the rooms are more 4 star than 3 with modern fittings. The washing area is a bit cramped but the separate shower cubicle is very spacious and powerful. The towels are more 2 star, very threadbare and the pillows are like marshallows; next year I shall bring my own. I would figure that 90% of guests choose this hotel because of its location and therefore it is very much a business hotel. Most guests are likely to arrive late in the afternoon or evening having worked that day so that they can attend a trade show the next day; so the picture I am painting is that most guests WILL NEED TO IRON A SHIRT. WHY THEN IS THERE ONLY ONE IRONING BOARD FOR THE ENTIRE HOTEL !!!!! We had to wait until 9am the next morning to access it. Breakfasts are adequate although more cut fresh fruit would be pleasant. This is not a luxurious hotel, nor is it pretending to be - however the greatest luxury is walking to and from the trade show without having to take a taxi etc

Reviews.Title: “No complaints at all...”
Reviews.Author: stemail
Reviews.Content: This hotel is clean, tidy, quiet and friendly and I had a very good experience staying here. It is very well situated for public transport by bus or subway. The breakfast was extremely good. There are a few nice places to eat in the locality. The hotel bar is uninspiring, to be fair just like most hotel bars. I heartily recommend a two minute walk to Kastanienallee off Reichstrasse (the road parallel to Heerstrasse) where you will find a fabulous German bar called West End bar. Friendly, cosy and lively. Try a shot of Geneva. You will feel totally safe on the short wander back to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable and close to U2 station”
Reviews.Author: Bubba&MaryJo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights on a recent long weekend visit to Berlin. Although the hotel is uninspiring from the outside, don’t let that put you off. Once inside, the hotel is clean, bright, modern and looks and feels very new. The staff we encountered were unobtrusive, but polite and helpful when approached, with a good grasp of English (far better than our German!) Our room, on the 2nd floor, was to the rear of the building, overlooking the car park. As with any hotel, the rooms at the front may well suffer from traffic noise – we can’t confirm either way, although the traffic past the hotel didn’t strike us as being too busy at any time of the day. Worth thinking about, though, if you’re a light sleeper. Our room was advertised and booked (via Airmiles) as a double, but actually turned out to be a twin. Although the plinth was one piece, the mattresses and bedding were for two single beds and not a double but this meant we didn’t steal each others bedding! The toilet, which is completely separate from the shower and sink, was bright and tiled with large ceramic tiles. The shower and sink area, (separated by a sliding, opaque door from the bedroom area) is beautifully tiled in granite and well lit. The shower cubicle itself which has a glass shower door, not a curtain, is quite spacious. A hair dryer is provided here too. A wardrobe (a few more coat hangers would have been useful!), dressing table and chair, bedside table and a stool complete the rest of the furniture. There is a flat screen TV (with BBC World & CNN providing English language channels) and air-conditioning. The windows are large and can be opened making the room bright and open. Access to our room was through two doors. The first door opened from the hotel corridor to what could be described as a very small lobby, with two further secure doors giving access to two individual rooms. This arrangement may well be a bonus for families or groups travelling together. We had a couple of very minor issues with the room. The hotel provides a bottle of water in the room, with a €2 price tag attached. Don’t bother opening it – there’s nothing wrong with the water from the tap! Also, the room lacked any sort of tea / coffee making facilities, something which we really missed. Having said that, nothing we read about the hotel in advance suggested these facilities would exist, therefore, it’s our fault for expecting it. Breakfast is provided on the ground floor in the open plan dining, bar and reception area. A selection of cereals, breads, fruit, tea / coffee / juice, scrambled eggs, sausage, and so on are provided on a buffet basis and we had no complaints at all with the choice or quality available. The hotel is just a two minute walk from the nearest U-Bahn station, Theodor-Heuss-Platz. This station is on one of the main lines (U2) so there’s access to, for example, Postdamer-Platz and Alexandr-Platz without the need to change trains. However, as this station is near the end of the line it does take some travelling time to get anywhere – Postdamer-Platz is around 25 minutes away and Alexandr-Platz is around 40 minutes away. With Berlin’s excellent public transport system we didn’t mind being so far out from the centre, but this does need to be considered if you’re heading anywhere with a deadline to meet, e.g. to meet up with an organised tour. The area immediately surrounding the hotel has a few restaurants, takeaways, decent coffee shop, supermarket, etc. and in our experience, felt perfectly safe. We had no trouble at all, even when returning to the hotel very late at night (although we didn’t explore the surroundings much, only really walking back and forth from the hotel to the U-Bahn station). All in all a good place to stay and we would use it again if back in Berlin.

HotelInfo.Name: Ivbergs Hotel Berlin Messe
HotelInfo.Address: Heerstrasse 5, 14057 Berlin, Germany
